Class TerminalController

java.lang.Object
Client.TerminalController
All Implemented Interfaces:
ClientUI
public class TerminalController extends Object implements ClientUI
Controller for the public terminal screen. Responsibilities:
  • Binds itself as the active ClientUI receiver via ClientSession.bindUI(ClientUI).
  • Sends requests to the server using Envelope wrapped in KryoMessage.
  • Maintains simple in-flight flags to prevent duplicate requests while a request is pending.
  • Updates JavaFX UI safely on the FX thread using Platform.runLater(Runnable).
Notes:
  • UI controls are intentionally kept enabled; request flags prevent spam/double-clicks.
  • The controller supports two server payload formats for some operations (DTO-based and legacy String-based), to remain backward compatible.

  • Method Details

    • onConnected

      public void onConnected()
      Called when the client connection is established. Updates connection label and sets terminal status accordingly.
      Specified by:
      onConnected in interface ClientUI

    • onDisconnected

      public void onDisconnected()
      Called when the connection is closed. Updates UI status and resets in-flight flags so the user can retry after reconnect.
      Specified by:
      onDisconnected in interface ClientUI

    • onConnectionError

      public void onConnectionError(Exception e)
      Called on connection exceptions. Updates UI status and resets in-flight flags so the user can retry.
      Specified by:
      onConnectionError in interface ClientUI
      Parameters:
      e - the exception describing the connection error

    • handleServerMessage

      public void handleServerMessage(Object message)
      Central dispatcher for server messages arriving through ClientSession. Implementation details:
      • Unwraps the incoming message into Envelope (supports direct Envelope or KryoMessage).
      • Switches by OpCode and updates UI accordingly.
      • Unlocks relevant in-flight flags on response.
      Runs on JavaFX thread via Platform.runLater(Runnable).
      Specified by:
      handleServerMessage in interface ClientUI
      Parameters:
      message - the raw message object sent by the server
